title: RBI permits UPI transactions via PPI wallets using third-party apps - The Times of India
summary:
RBI Permits UPI Transactions via PPI Wallets Using Third-Party Apps

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has approved the use of third-party applications for UPI transactions facilitated through Prepaid Payment Instruments (PPI) wallets. This move aims to increase the accessibility and usability of UPI services for consumers.

  • RBI's new directive enables an increased number of digital wallet providers to facilitate UPI transactions.
  • This decision is expected to enhance the financial inclusion landscape in India.
  • The RBI ensures that transactions remain secure while introducing convenience for users.
“This is a significant advancement towards enhancing digital payment systems in India.”

This development is expected to foster competition among digital payment platforms and improve user experience.
newTitle: RBI Permits UPI Transactions via PPI Wallets Using Third-Party Apps

summary:
2024 Kia Sonet Achieves 1 Lakh Sales Milestone in Less Than a Year

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: CarDekho.com

The 2024 Kia Sonet has crossed 1 lakh sales in just 11 months since its launch in January, showcasing its popularity in the subcompact SUV segment.

  • 79% of total sales are from variants equipped with a sunroof.
  • 76% of sales are from petrol-powered variants.
  • 34% of customers prefer automatic and iMT transmission variants.
  • Features include dual 10.25-inch screens, ventilated front seats, and advanced safety features.
  • Offers three engine options: 1.2-litre naturally aspirated petrol, 1-litre turbo-petrol, and 1.5-litre diesel.
  • Priced from Rs 8 lakh to Rs 15.77 lakh (ex-showroom Delhi).

This achievement highlights the growing trust among consumers and reinforces Kia's commitment to delivering innovative products that exceed customer expectations.

title: Current account deficit narrows to $11.2 billion in Q2FY25 - The Economic Times
summary:
Current account deficit at $11.2 billion in July-September

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Economic Times

The current account deficit for the July-September quarter stood at $11.2 billion, representing 1.2% of GDP, slightly lower than the revised figure of $11.3 billion for the same period last year.

  • The deficit was $9.7 billion, or 1.1% of GDP, in the preceding quarter.
  • The figures are reported by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).
“The current account deficit was $11.2 billion in the reporting quarter.”

This slight reduction in the deficit indicates a marginal improvement in the balance of payments situation.
newTitle: Current Account Deficit Reaches $11.2 Billion in Q2

title: From Rs 20 Lakh A Day To Zero, Startup Founder Shares How Amazon Ended His Dream - News18
summary:
Startup Founder Shares Journey from Rs 20 Lakh A Day to Zero Due to Amazon Competition

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: News18

An Indian startup founder recently shared his heartbreaking journey of business downfall, which used to generate Rs 20 lakh per day. His home organiser company faced a sudden crash when Amazon launched a competing brand, wiping out his revenue.

  • The founder started his business in 2017, finding an opportunity in overpriced storage products on Amazon.
  • After initial success, Amazon's launch of similar products severely impacted his sales.
  • The founder shared insights on the risks of relying solely on one platform like Amazon.
  • He emphasized the importance of building a strong brand and diversifying sales channels.
“I went from selling 20L of products per day to watching my generational-wealth dream crumble under Amazon.”

This experience highlights the challenges faced by small businesses in competitive environments, particularly against large corporations.
newTitle: Startup Founder Shares Journey from Rs 20 Lakh A Day to Zero Due to Amazon Competition

title: Consumption Expenditure Survey 2023-24: Non-food items lead household spending trends; rent major contributor - Upstox
summary:
Consumption Expenditure Survey 2023-24: Non-food items lead household spending trends; rent major contributor

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

The 2023-24 Consumption Expenditure Survey reveals a narrowing urban-rural gap in consumption expenditure, with non-food items dominating household spending.

  • The urban-rural gap in monthly per capita consumption expenditure (MPCE) decreased to 70% in 2023-24.
  • Average MPCE was ₹4,122 in rural and ₹6,996 in urban areas, rising to ₹4,247 and ₹7,078 when including government welfare benefits.
  • Sikkim had the highest MPCE, while Chhattisgarh recorded the lowest.
  • Non-food items account for 53% of rural and 60% of urban household expenditures.
  • The Gini coefficient for inequality declined in both rural (0.237) and urban (0.284) areas.
  • Rent constitutes around 7% of urban non-food expenditure.
“Rent with a share of around 7% is another major constituent of households’ non-food expenditure in urban India.”

Overall, the survey highlights significant trends in consumption patterns and a decrease in inequality, impacting economic indicators such as GDP and CPI.
newTitle: Consumption Expenditure Survey 2023-24: Non-food items lead household spending trends; rent major contributor

title: Mamata Machinery Share Price, IPO Listing Highlights: IPO lists at 147% premium on NSE, shares up lock in upper circuit - The Financial Express
summary:
Mamata Machinery Share Price, IPO listing Highlights: IPO lists at 147% premium on NSE, shares up lock in upper circuit

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Financial Express

The IPO of Mamata Machinery was listed at a remarkable 147% premium on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) today, reflecting overwhelming market response with a total oversubscription of 194.95 times.

  • The IPO was subscribed 138.08 times by retail investors.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) subscribed 235.88 times.
  • The company raised Rs 179.39 crore by selling 74 lakh shares.
  • Stock closed at Rs 629.95 on BSE, gaining 4.99%.
“At the upper price band company is valued at a P/E of 16.6x,” said Anand Rathi Research.

This strong listing is backed by Mamata Machinery's robust positioning in the packaging machinery sector and positive market sentiments surrounding the IPO.

title: Ark's Cathie Wood calls for tax clarity as she rides 'Trump bump' | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Cathie Wood Urges Tax Clarity from Trump's Administration

Publication Date: Dec 27
Source: Reuters

Cathie Wood, a prominent U.S. tech investor, is advocating for clarity on tax policies from Donald Trump's incoming administration. She believes backdating tax cuts to January 1, 2025, would stimulate economic growth.

  • Wood's ARK Innovation ETF has surged 17% post-Trump's victory, outperforming the S&P500.
  • Key holdings Tesla and Coinbase have seen significant increases in their stock prices since November.
  • Wood supports Trump's economic platform, advocating for reduced tariffs and tax cuts.
  • Analysts expect a push for tax reform by the new Congress, with Trump poised to use executive orders to implement policies.
  • Wood has not financially supported Trump but maintains contact with key figures like Elon Musk and Senator Cynthia Lummis.
“I see them saying, okay, we're going to cut taxes but we will make them retroactive to Jan. 1, 2025. That would be very helpful, I think, in terms of providing certainty for the markets.” - Cathie Wood

Wood believes that while the market's initial excitement may fade, innovation-driven sectors will benefit in the long run.
newTitle: Cathie Wood Urges Tax Clarity from Trump's Administration

Indian low-cost carrier Akasa Air has announced a New Year Sale, offering discounts on fares across its domestic and international routes. One-way tickets for domestic routes will start from ₹1,599, and customers can avail up to 25% discount on international bookings with the promo code NEWYEAR.

Key Points

  • Booking period: From December 31, 2024, to January 3, 2025, for travel starting January 7, 2025.
  • Applies to 'Saver' and 'Flexi' fares, covering one-way and round-trip tickets.

  • Akasa Air's network covers 22 domestic and 5 international cities.

title: Osamu Suzuki, who led Japanese automaker into India, dies at 94 - The Hindu
summary:
Osamu Suzuki, Pioneer of Suzuki Motor and Indian Auto Market, Dies at 94

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: [Source Name]

Osamu Suzuki, a legendary figure in the automotive industry and former chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation, passed away at the age of 94 on Christmas Day due to lymphoma. He was instrumental in transforming the Indian auto market and expanding Suzuki's global reach.

  • Suzuki led Suzuki Motor for over 40 years, significantly impacting the automotive landscape.
  • He focused on cost efficiency, which shaped the company's operations, including lowering factory ceilings for savings.
  • Under his leadership, Suzuki launched the Maruti 800, revolutionizing the Indian car market.
  • Suzuki played a key role in establishing a partnership with Maruti at a time when India had limited car production.
  • His quirky personality and humor were noted, often playfully stating he would stay with the company 'forever.'
  • The company he built retains about 40% of the Indian car market today.
“To be number one somewhere in the world” was his motivation for investing in India.

Osamu Suzuki’s legacy will continue through the ongoing success of Maruti Suzuki, marking a significant chapter in automotive history.
newTitle: Osamu Suzuki, Pioneer of Suzuki Motor and Indian Auto Market, Dies at 94

title: SaaS fintech Zaggle plans at least 2 acquisitions next fiscal to drive growth | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
SaaS fintech Zaggle plans at least 2 acquisitions next fiscal to drive growth

Date: December 27, 2023

Source: PTI

Zaggle Prepaid Ocean Services Ltd, a SaaS fintech platform, aims to acquire at least two companies in the next financial year to stimulate growth. The company recently raised ₹595 crore through a qualified institutional placement to support this initiative.

  • The fintech is assessing 5 to 6 potential acquisition targets, focusing on merchant card software, accounts receivables, and FASTag solutions.
  • Founder Raj Narayanam mentioned a goal of reaching a billion-dollar revenue target within the next 5 to 6 years.
  • Zaggle has previously invested ₹48 crore to acquire stakes in Span Across IT Solutions and Mobileware Technologies.
  • The latest funding round attracted major institutional investors and involved the allotment of 1.13 crore equity shares.
  • For the July-September quarter, Zaggle reported a three-fold increase in net profit, amounting to ₹20.3 crore and a 64.22% year-over-year revenue growth to ₹302.5 crore.
“We are aiming for a billion-dollar revenue target within the next 5 to 6 years,” - Raj Narayanam

In conclusion, Zaggle is strategically positioning itself for growth through timely acquisitions and financial investments, which could significantly enhance its market presence in the fintech industry.
newTitle: SaaS Fintech Zaggle Plans Acquisitions for Growth

title: Top 5 Electric Cars Launched In 2024 - Mahindra To MG - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
Top 5 Electric Cars Launched In 2024 - Mahindra To MG

Publication Date: 2024
Source: GaadiWadi

2024 was a year of several major electric car launches. Intending to break Tata Motors’ dominance in the category, Mahindra launched two of its highly anticipated premium models. Tata Motors meanwhile expanded its portfolio in both entry and premium segments with two EVs. JSW MG Motor, on the other hand, introduced a first-of-its-kind electric car for our market. Here’s a wrap of the top 5 electric car launches of the year:

  • Mahindra XEV 9e: Range of 656 km and 0-100 km/h in 6.8 seconds. Price: INR 21.90 lakh
  • Mahindra BE6: Maximum range of 682 km and 0-100 km/h in 6.7 seconds. Price: INR 18.90 lakh
  • Tata Punch.ev: Only electric micro-SUV with a range of 365 km. Price: INR 9.99 lakh
  • Tata Curvv.ev: First SUV-coupe made in India with a maximum range of 502 km. Price: INR 17.49 lakh
  • MG Windsor: Crossover-styled hatchback with a range of 332 km. Prices from INR 13.50 lakh
“2024 was a pivotal year in the electric vehicle market with innovative launches across various segments.”

The electric vehicle market in India is rapidly evolving, with various manufacturers pushing the boundaries of technology and design.

title: Explained | Why rupee is in a free fall against the US Dollar - CNBCTV18
summary:
Why the Rupee is Plummeting Against the US Dollar

Publication Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: CNBC TV 18

The Indian rupee has recently seen a sharp decline, hitting a record low of 85.81 against the US dollar. Key factors contributing to this drop include a strengthening dollar, increased demand from importers, and potential policy shifts by the Reserve Bank of India.

  • The US Dollar has strengthened due to market expectations of the Trump administration's policies and a hawkish Federal Reserve.
  • The rupee's significant single-day fall was noted on December 27, reaching an all-time low.
  • Increased demand for dollars, particularly from oil importers, is exerting pressure on the rupee.
  • The Reserve Bank of India's policy may be adjusting to allow a more free-market determination of the rupee's value.
  • Despite this, the rupee has remained relatively strong compared to other emerging market currencies year-to-date.
Mitul Kotecha, Head of FX and EM Macro Strategy Asia at Barclays, stated, "the rupee is likely to weaken further, reaching 87 against the dollar by the end of next year, despite temporary measures to slow its fall. However, it is expected to outperform its Asian peers."

In conclusion, while the rupee faces challenges in the current market context, its long-term performance relative to other currencies remains to be closely monitored.
newTitle: Why the Rupee is Plummeting Against the US Dollar

title: Tata Capital IPO: Listing Date, Valuation And Ownership — All You Need To Know - NDTV Profit
summary:
Tata Capital IPO: Listing Date, Valuation And Ownership — All You Need To Know

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Profit

Tata Capital Ltd., the financial services arm of Tata Group, is preparing for a public listing by September 2025 after its merger with Tata Motor Finance.

  • The merger will be voted on by unsecured creditors on January 17, 2025.
  • Tata Capital is classified as an upper-layer systemically important non-banking financial company (NBFC), which mandates a listing within three years.
  • For FY2024, Tata Capital reported a profit after tax of Rs 3,327 crore.
  • The merged entity will have assets under management of Rs 2.30 lakh crore as of March 31, 2024.
  • The RBI approved the merger of Tata Capital and Tata Motor Finance in October 2024.
The proforma book value of the merged NBFC stood at Rs 31,603 crore at the end of September 2024, thereby valuing the company at three times book value.

The upcoming IPO of Tata Capital is significant as it represents a consolidation in the Tata Group's financial services sector, positioning it for growth in a competitive market.
newTitle: Tata Capital IPO: Listing Date, Valuation And Ownership — All You Need To Know

Rupee's fall worsens as it hits 85.80 against dollar, set for worst month in two years - Moneycontrol
summary:
Rupee Hits 85.80 Against Dollar, Facing Worst Month in Two Years

Date: December 27, 2024 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian Rupee has hit a fresh low of 85.80 against the US dollar, marking the worst expected month in two years, driven by strong demand for dollars in the non-deliverable forwards (NDF) market.

  • The Rupee has weakened by 3% against the US dollar for the year.
  • This marks the Rupee's seventh consecutive year of annual losses.
  • Analysts project the Rupee could reach 86 against the dollar by the end of March.
  • The RBI has not indicated any changes in intervention strategy under the new governor.
Nuvama Institutional has projected that the Rupee could hit 86 against the dollar by end of March.

This continuing depreciation raises concerns regarding economic stability and the effectiveness of current forex strategies.
newTitle: Rupee Hits 85.80 Against Dollar, Facing Worst Month in Two Years

title: Memecoin Degens Raise Millions for Rare Cancer Research After a Father’s Plea - CoinDesk
summary:
Memecoin Degens Raise Millions for Rare Cancer Research After a Father’s Plea

Published: Dec 27, 2024, 7:56 a.m. UTC | Source: CoinDesk

A memecoin called MIRA raised over $1 million for brain cancer research after a significant push from crypto traders motivated by a father’s appeal for help in funding research for his daughter's rare brain tumor.

  • MIRA token surged to an $80 million market cap with trading volumes reaching nearly $100 million.
  • Siqi Chen, the father, has a GoFundMe campaign aiming to raise $300,000 for research efforts that hit 80% of its goal.
  • The token's price fell after its peak, but it garnered considerable attention and trading activity.
  • Community response highlighted the potential of memecoins to fund social causes.
  • Chen plans to liquidate $1,000 worth of MIRA every 10 minutes to support research.
“I will be liquidating $1,000 worth of $MIRA every 10 minutes, perpetually. If I change this schedule, I commit to announcing it 24 hours in advance.” — Siqi Chen

Community engagement has been positive, indicating a shift in how memecoins are perceived in contributing to charitable causes.
newTitle: Memecoin Degens Raise Millions for Rare Cancer Research After a Father's Plea

  • Cellecor Gadgets' shares were locked at a 5% upper circuit on December 27, 2024.
  • The company partnered with Dixon Electro Manufacturing Private Limited to manufacture premium refrigerators.
  • Post-announcement, the stock's price increased to ₹64.25 from ₹61.20.
  • Shares trade 30% below their IPO price of ₹92.
  • In the last month, stock has gained 15%, and 122% over the past year.
  • Income from operations for H1 FY25 was ₹425.71 crore, up 103% YoY.
  • Profit after tax surged to ₹14.62 crore, a 108.26% increase from the previous year.

Notable Statistics

The IPO was subscribed 116.33 times.

newTitle: Cellecor Gadgets Partners with Dixon Tech, Stock Hits Upper Circuit
